private_information: I hold disks from top to bottom: A,B,C,D,E,F,G
I can only move the top disk of my stack
left_peg.goal: Help achieve the final configuration where right peg has all disks ordered from smallest (top) to largest (bottom).

middle_peg.goal: Help achieve the final configuration where right peg has all disks ordered from smallest (top) to largest (bottom).

right_peg.goal: Help achieve the final configuration where right peg has all disks ordered from smallest (top) to largest (bottom).

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem file for the Tower of Hanoi with 7 disks that can be solved by the FastDownward planner, integrating the peg agents state reports.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left middle and right
There are 7 disks labeled A B C D E F G from smallest A to largest G
Only one disk may be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg top to bottom A B C D E F G middle peg empty right peg empty
Goal configuration: right peg top to bottom A B C D E F G left and middle pegs empty

report_state.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the left peg. Provide a concise structured description of your current stack and which disk is on top. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the information you have about your peg.
report_state.prompt: You are left_peg. Use the public information and your private information to describe your current state and what top disk you can move. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->left_peg->private_information} Goal: {agents->left_peg->goal}

report_state.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the middle peg. Provide a concise structured description of your current stack and which disk is on top. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the information you have about your peg.
report_state.prompt: You are middle_peg. Use the public information and your private information to describe your current state and what top disk you can move. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->middle_peg->private_information} Goal: {agents->middle_peg->goal}

report_state.system_prompt: You are the agent representing the right peg. Provide a concise structured description of your current stack and which disk is on top. Do not produce PDDL. Provide only the information you have about your peg.
report_state.prompt: You are right_peg. Use the public information and your private information to describe your current state and what top disk you can move. Public information: {environment->public_information} Private information: {agents->right_peg->private_information} Goal: {agents->right_peg->goal}

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at producing PDDL domain and problem files targeting the FastDownward planner. Integrate the state reports from the peg agents and create a single PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi constraints for 7 disks and three pegs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not include any additional text outside these tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive three structured state reports from the peg agents. Use the public information to ensure consistency and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward to solve the global goal: move the stack from left peg to right peg preserving disk order. Public information: {environment->public_information} Peg reports: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}
